sentence.Network_en: Portugal and Spain had possessed vast empires that waxed and waned.
sentence.Network_cn: 葡萄牙和西班牙都曾是经历了兴衰的大帝国。

sentence.Network_en: New states were born out of the wreckage of old colonial empires.
sentence.Network_cn: 新生国家从老殖民帝国的废墟中诞生。

sentence.Network_en: Around the Morgan and Rockefeller empires clustered a number of smaller kingdoms.
sentence.Network_cn: 在摩根和洛克菲勒帝国周围,麇集着一些较小的王国.

PerfectNetExp.abs: 在美国这样一个到处都是霸权事务的国家，如此评价几乎意味着一种谴责，那不仅仅是爱默生个人的心痛和失望。读者们也许忘记了，爱默生在那篇颂文的结尾，强调似的将梭罗比作以高贵纯洁著称的“火绒草”，(333)。爱默生和梭罗的区别也集中表现在“霸权(empires)”这一问题上，对此梭罗在《瓦尔登湖》中写道：
it has been independent state for centuries at a time , but it has also been part of the Roman , Byzantine and Ottoman empires .她曾独立过几世纪，却也一度沦为罗马帝国、拜占庭帝国和鄂图曼土耳其帝国的领土。
and we all remember what followed that collapse of empires and the emergence of a new order .我们都清楚地知道那次旧帝国崩溃、新秩序涌现后发生的一切。
vaster than empires and more slow .发展得比那些帝国还寥廓，还缓慢。

entry.def: An empire is a number of individual nations that are all controlled by the government or ruler of one particular country.
You can refer to a group of companies controlled by one person as an empire .

example.tran: 庞大的蒙达多利出版帝国

auth_sentence.content: Some empires manage to rebound but most don't.
